title: The food and the staff are excellent!
text:
Sometimes I feel like Norman walking into "Cheers" bar (a tv series from "way back to when". 
 It's a friendly, welcoming environment. I've ordered specialty cakes them a number of times. My favorite is the "Earl grey with lavender icing" cake. 
  Some of the staff are nothing but smiles, especially early in the morning.
 Great neighborhood spot, a great addition to the community.

title: Most practical app of all time!
text: This is like too good to be true! I just grabbed a huge amount of delicious pizza and awesome Puerto Rican food, 5 bucks each! These are restaurants I‚Äôve never tried before both delicious. I‚Äôm always looking for a deal do this makes my heart so happy! I am so glad the food isn‚Äôt getting thrown away either! This is amazing!

title: What a great idea!
text:
I absolutely love this app and I have only used it once and there is only one restaurant in my area on it. But the concept is genius. Instead of throwing away food, the restaurant gets to make a little and we get great food at a huge discount. A win-win all around!!  

I really hope more places in my area get on board with this idea.

title: Nothing ever available.
text: I live in the middle of Seattle, you‚Äôd think places would have leftovers but there‚Äôs never anything available. For weeks I‚Äôve checked daily and the same places are always under ‚Äúyou just missed it‚Äù I mean, did I really ‚Äújust‚Äù miss it? It seems like they‚Äôre never available. And there‚Äôs one place that‚Äôs ALWAYS got leftovers apparently? 24/7..? The whole thing just doesn‚Äôt seem like it works. I wanted to like this app and use it but what‚Äôs the point? There‚Äôs nothing to get..

title: Needs notifications!
text: The concept of this app is incredible but I wish they could send out notifications when a store has something available. You really get a lot of food for what you pay. The only problem I have is that there is no notification system that notifies you when a store becomes available. By the time I check the app my favorite stores are already sold out most of the time.

title: Great Concept -App is Not the Most User-Friendly
text: I love TooGood To Go so far, however you are scrolling quite blind in regards to locations. You have to go through two clicks before seeing actual locations of establishments. This is very annoying. Some restaurants have gone around this by putting their address or neighborhood in their restaurant name so it is more obvious to the user.  Please have a better map function and sort function.

title: Great app, love the misson
text: I really like this app, the mission, and the fact that food doesn‚Äôt go to waste. I have also tried out a couple new places that I would not have known about otherwise and have even gone back to some of those small businesses to pay the regular price because their food was so good

title: Love love love
text: I love this app. I save money, I save the environment AND the best part, I don‚Äôt have to cook. I hate cooking!!  I wish more restaurants would join. Right now the area that has the most participation is in a city, not as much the farther you go from the city. Also majority of the places that are joining are bakeries which can be dangerous to the waistline. Lol But overall I love this app.

title: Good
text:
The most safe options to first try out are bakery shops. 

It would be more convenient if even if the item was ‚Äúsold out‚Äù, that the general time for pickup is listed because then it would be easier to look out for possible options. I would use the app more then because some options are always sold out before I can even consider it.

title: Great concept
text: There is such a waste and this is a great idea.  I wish there were more participants- I was spoiled by my first pickup- a grocery bags of goods and treats - tried 2 others and even though one was a bust - the other I got a lunch bag of treats. Basically we need to have more restaurants in Connecticut- I sent this to a few people and there is nothing in their area

title: Good idea, poorly executed and supported
text: Love the idea of reducing restaurant wastefulness. Unfortunately this app doesn‚Äôt allow for good communication and the company supports companies changing the terms AFTER you purchase items. Due to the pickup timeframes listed, customers can see if something works, but after purchase this app allows companies to change the terms (regularly!) and customers only get a message stating if new terms don‚Äôt work just cancel. Missing the idea of food rescuing being included in a person‚Äôs schedule (way home, way to work, etc.).

title: Finally answer to what I‚Äôm going to do for meals
text: Love This it‚Äôs Amazing! I was worried about the food quality at first but the food has been really fresh good quality. Not Expired. Finally now I know what I‚Äôm going to do for meals. Healthy if you want and great value. Love this!!!! One feedback is maybe their could also be environmentally friendly way for containers but I love it!!!!

title: Finally!
text: I can‚Äôt believe this didn‚Äôt exist sooner, but I‚Äôm so glad it‚Äôs here now. I feel so good about the food that I save, and my wallet feels great too! This needs to be available everywhere-as a creature of habit, this app has introduced me to SO many new businesses! Too good to go, you have thoroughly impressed people EVERYWHERE. Let‚Äôs keep this gravy train going! So much gratitude!!!

title: Love this concept!!
text: I wish I had started this sooner.  I was informed of this app weeks ago and forgot about it.  Tonight I did my first two deals, with each restaurant offering $3.99/tax per mystery item.  In all I scored 4, with each retailing for $12.  So I ended up saving $32, and the food was still fresh and could even hold for a day or two.

title: Saving awesome food from being wasted!
text: One of my favorite apps now because it‚Äôs a great cause save food wastage and it sure helps me food wise! I sent your application to my instruction for Senior Vitality Ipad Instruction for seniors to present to people in their classes! Actually I wouldn‚Äôt have found your app without learning how to use the ipad in my Senior Vitality ipad class!

title: Wonderful!!!
text: What a fun idea! I love the concept for the restraint and the foodie! I‚Äôm not a picky eater and enjoy trying new things. For the restaurateur, this app brings customers in the door and hopefully creates a loyal customer! Might as well sell perfectly good food that you‚Äôre going to toss anyway! I‚Äôm so excited to try as many restaurants/bakeries as possible. Thank you!!!

title: Wish for more locations
text: 1st time partaking in this app and picking a food item up.  I was skeptical at first, worried that I would get some nasty over cooked leftover from the day.  It wasn‚Äôt like that at all.  I decided for my first try the pizza place was safe.  While I didn‚Äôt get anything amazing, I did get a full delicious cheese pizza and it was definitely worth the discounted cost . And it was fresh .  I‚Äôll try it again!

title: Great Food Choices!
text: Free app, extremely low priced food! I decided to give a try & get a mystery take out for just $3.99 at one of my favorite places! The amount of food I got was enough to feed 4 people and it was great! They have lots of restaurants & caf√©s to choose from. I like that they give a time window to pick-up. Great app saving food from waste!!

title: Incredible!
text: Too Good To Go is the gift that keeps on giving. I, like most, began using this app in an attempt to reduce food waste. It‚Äôs so much more. I‚Äôve learned about multiple restaurants and cafes in my area that I wouldn‚Äôt have come across and eaten really incredible food I probably wouldn‚Äôt have tried on my own. I‚Äôm floored by this app. What a great idea!

title: Love this, wish more places used it.
text: This app is so good. The UX is perfect and it‚Äôs a cool way to try and discover places I wouldn‚Äôt normally go. There‚Äôs only two businesses in my town that use this and we use the app regularly at one of them. I hope more chains start using this because it‚Äôs such a cool way to reduce food waste and cover costs.

title: TGTG is Pure Genius!
text: The app is a benefit to all parties - the businesses that participate, the users who purchase the leftover food and most importantly all the communities where TGTG is available because the prevention of food waste is huge. I love this concept and my family benefits greatly as well from all the great food that I might not be able to afford otherwise.

title: Easy to use
text: Could be a bit more intuitive by showing locations on a map. Otherwise you have to mark them as your favorite. All depends on the restaurant what you get and how many so I recommend trying a few at low amounts and finding out. Great gifts for teachers or administration to start the day!

title: Great app
text: I love th√© app. It connects local businesses with people who would like to purchase food at a reduced price and decreases food waste. I also love that the app shows how much you have saved in food waste and $$ One small ask would it be possible to add notifications if your favorite adds a bag? It would be really helpful Thanks

title: I feel scammed
text:
There‚Äôs a restaurant called ‚ÄúMy mamas Vegan‚Äù 

they are on this app I reserved my food, paid upfront showed up to Pick up said food and the store was completely shut down. 
As in won‚Äôt be open for business for the next few weeks, the store was even operable it‚Äôs like they signed up opened an account specifically to take ppls money.  I contacted the app to receive my refund and haven‚Äôt heard back. 
My advice is to CALL the store first and confirm that this is an actual thing and pay while your in the store talking to someone or get burned like me

title: love this concept !!
text: This is such a good idea and i was so excited but i was disappointed to realize there weren‚Äôt any in my location (richmond, va), which I know isn‚Äôt their fault. I think they need to work on their marketing and spreading awareness so that more places join. Also they need to make it so that you can see reviews for each restaurant and not just a rating.

title: Not too good
text: The concept is ideal but the reality isn‚Äôt the same. Didn‚Äôt have a good experience at all. I always tried to see the good in everything and take time to give my opinion. My first experience the person in the restaurant wasn‚Äôt aware I was coming even I send the confirmation. He gives me anything, not a real purpose. The second time the restaurant was closed. They charged me and still waiting my refund. For those reason they lack of transparency and the well intentions.

title: Great app, need more notifications
text: I love this concept and enjoy the food I get, but I find that it‚Äôs really hard to actually get a meal at the restaurant I want. I wish there was a notification telling me when my favorited restaurants are available, because right now it‚Äôs just a game of luck that I open the app at a good time.

title: Great app, could be better
text:
I wish the companies banner represented the company better. They all look like stock photos which doesn‚Äôt represent the store or what you may get.

I wish we can see submitted customer reviews from each store with images to see the food they give out. Regardless, love the app. Great way to try out new foods and stores when reducing food waste!!!

title: Awesome app
text: Most of it in nyc isn‚Äôt ‚Äú food rescue‚Äù‚Ä¶ here they more charge you for a small plate but the food is high quality. Great way to sample from restaurants. I know in other states people use this app different. This app is great overall and thank you for doing this. It helps a lot especially if you get a bag from a supermarket or bakery.

title: I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs great as long as you don‚Äôt have dietary needs
text:
I was excited to try this but because everything is a ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù there is no way to filter for special dietary needs such as allergies, halal, kosher, gluten free or in my case, vegan. They suggest you ‚Äúlet the restaurant know‚Äù when you‚Äôre get there, but that seems like an exercise in frustration (for both me and the restaurant) and seems likely to fail. 

It‚Äôs too bad, because it‚Äôs a good idea. It just doesn‚Äôt work for me without some ability to assure that I can actually eat the food I‚Äôm getting.

title: Amazing
text: I was shocked to hear about this app from a friend few weeks ago. I love the concept of not wasting food and being able to be a part of that is even better. I‚Äôve been able to explore new restaurants in my neighborhoods while also doing a service for the world.

title: Not worth it
text: We went to Rocco‚Äôs in Bradley Beach at 8:30 to pick up our Surprise Box and was offered 2 cold slices of pizza. When we said we could have just come in anytime and bought 2 hot slices for 88 cents more than what we paid for the surprise box, they offered us 4 slices (cold).  Meanwhile, they had a lot of pizzas just sitting on the counter. They said they never agreed to go on the app. Probably not their fault I am guessing so I am thinking there was some kind of communication breakdown along the way. I won‚Äôt fall for this scam again and deleted the app.

title: Scammers. No refunds. You won‚Äôt get your bag that you paid for.
text: Terrible execution and food is still being wasted. I ordered from shipleys donuts and when I arrived the doors were locked and I saw the lady inside throwing away all the trays of donuts. These could have been too good to go bags right ? Nope. I did not receive my order. I arrived two hours before the store is supposed to close. I arrived on time and I am upset that I still haven‚Äôt received a refund. A refund on old food that I didn‚Äôt even receive. Like wow. Terrible app and even worse customer service.

title: Too good to be true‚Ä¶
text: What can I say. We thought ok let‚Äôs try it. We paid in advance the evening before. Received the notice to pick up our ‚Äúsurprise bag‚Äù between 1:30p and 2p. We arrived at 1:33 and we were told our order was just canceled because they over sold the ‚Äúsurprise bags‚Äù.  I was told we should have our money returned. That was a waste of gas and time. Not to mention it was somewhat embarrassing. That was the 1st and LAST time using the APP. Consider this a PSA.  You don‚Äôt get everything you pay for. If it seems too go to be true then likely it is.

title: Love This App!
text: So far over the past few months, we have had only wonderful experiences with our orders. The food is fresh and delicious, and such a bargain. Only wish we had more places to choose from. Have only been to Le Pain Quotidian. More restaurants and businesses need to participate in this app/service. It‚Äôs a win win win!

title: Value for a dollar in a tough economy
text: The only reason I didn‚Äôt give this five stars is because I would like a few more  varied restaurants in my area. Other than that I will say I have been quite happy with what I‚Äôve gotten because even if it‚Äôs something that I didn‚Äôt like was part of the surprise there was plenty of other things that I did like.

title: Hiding sold-out options
text:
I just updated the app, and noticed my favorite filter of hiding sold-out options gone. I hope it cones back, as it makes going through viable options easier.

Other than that- I enjoy the app immensely, and hope more businesses and cities pick it up!

title: Non existent customer service
text:
I had an experience with a restaurant cancelling my order after I already showed up to collect it. It was 10 pm so it wasn‚Äôt like there were many alternative places open to order from. I submitted a report to the app, got an email saying I‚Äôd receive a reply within a few days, and never heard back. 
I think there‚Äôs a fundamental flaw in the business plan. Because of the late pick up times, if something goes wrong, you‚Äôre left without food and it‚Äôs too late to find alternatives.

title: Needs review feature and to screen businesses
text:
I do think this all has the potential to be amazing if they would just add a review section.

While it‚Äôs fun to have a surprise bag of food, I do think it is important for people to talk about how much they received in order to manage expectations. Moreover, restaurants tend to be hit or miss, so please let people leave written reviews to describe what they received. 

Lastly, I don‚Äôt believe the app is always being used for the intended purpose by all restaurants. It seems like some restaurants aren‚Äôt using it to get rid of inventory that needs to be baked fresh daily but rather to increase sales at end of day. 

I was unpleasantly surprised when a bakery only gave me 5 cream puffs out of the 30 or so left at closing.

title: ‚ÄúOrder Completed‚Äù Should Be Endorsed by Customer
text: TGTG staff aren‚Äôt on ground to confirm if order has been picked up or not. In your subsequent update of the app, it would be important to make that concession for the customer, and/ or the store, to make this confirmation, and declare if the order was picked up/ completed, or not. TGTG app should not automatically update that; it takes away the right of the customer to make a decision during a business transaction.

title: Discover new neighbor eats
text: I like how it‚Äôs introduced me to some neighborhood places I‚Äôve never been to before and to items I‚Äôve haven‚Äôt tried before at places know well. While sometimes it can be a tad bit of a miss taste wise, for the value, variety, and eco-friendliness it can‚Äôt be beat. Getting 70-90% off good food? That‚Äôs a good deal.

title: For college students
text: Y‚Äôall I wish I had this app when I was in college. This app has come through and saved me from so many days and nights of starvation. Really. In all my 10 years of owning an iPhone, there‚Äôs never been an app that I‚Äôve loved as much as Too Good to Go. For real y‚Äôall. Don‚Äôt skip out on this one.

title: Delicious
text: Burger Press was our first order from the To Good To Go app, we were driving there from Prior Lake and thought that it wasn‚Äôt going to be worth the drive but‚Ä¶it was..!! We were very pleasantly surprised by the large steak burrito and fries for just $7. We got 3 orders and glad we did. I would definitely eat here again!!

title: Cool idea but there are 0 locations near me big city
text: I‚Äôm not sure if this app is new but I downloaded the app after seeing people rave about it online but there isn‚Äôt a single store offering it in a 20 mile radius. I feel like this would make sense if I live in a smaller state/city but I live in Orlando Florida. If it‚Äôs not available in big cities where is it available? I hope to see it expand but for now there was no reason for me to download.

title: Great concept to Reward Prevention of Waste!
text:
This is such a wonderful way to help small businesses from having to waste and throw away food! At the same time the customer gets a reward in the way of a discount for desired treats and food. It‚Äôs a win-win! We all love the surprise of a grab bag. 

Looking forward to more businesses joining to provide a greater variety and more options.

title: A nice way to try new restaurants on the cheap
text: If you‚Äôre on a budget (especially in an expensive area), this is a really fun way to try new spots without going into debt. I hope it‚Äôs actually reducing food waste, and not just optics. Either way, seems like a nice concept and it‚Äôs been worthwhile every time I‚Äôve used it!

title: AMAZING
text: This was my first experience with this restaurant and it did not disappoint. I picked up my order right away and the staff was so nice. He gave me several choices for what I wanted in my bag and made sure it was fresh if possible. I came home with so much more than I anticipated and it was all so amazing. Will definitely be back.

title: Sadly disappointed
text: The staff is great very kind and welcoming as was the atmosphere. The food I had was not good at all. It looked good but that was about it. I had chicken white rice with gravy cornbread and greens for one meal and the other was the same but with mashed potatoes. The chicken was way under seasoned the rice was very bland not even a pinch of salt and the gravy tasted burnt, cornbread was thick and didn‚Äôt even taste like cornbread the only thing that did taste good was the mashed potatoes. I was really hoping this would be my new favorite spot to get good food. I was mistaken.üòû

title: Amazing first experience
text: The company connects you with your local food business and helps food wastage. Used it for the first time to pickup a surprise box from a near by bakery. Wasn‚Äôt disappointed with the value and quality of products included. Would definitely recommend.

title: I Love This App, But Stop Tracking Me
text: This app is WONDERFUL - I‚Äôve told *several* friends and relatives about it (which I never do). This very smartly fills an enormous need the world-over: to help eliminate food waste. Imagine my chagrin when I noticed a couple entries under the ‚ÄúData Used to Track You‚Äù area in the App Privacy. For those of you who don‚Äôt know, that means this app can track what you‚Äôre doing on your phone **outside of this app**. There is NO REASON *any* app should need to do that, let alone an app to buy left-over food. If it weren‚Äôt for this, I‚Äôd give 5 stars.
